item.title: TAFCA league and KO 20/1
item.dc:creator: Ray Flood
item.description: Knockout. Dundee A v Castlehill Giants On paper a match you’d expect the defending champions to win, though the Castlehill side are clearly better than their allegro gradings would suggest. […]
item.content:encoded:
Knockout. Dundee A v Castlehill Giants

On paper a match you’d expect the defending champions to win, though the Castlehill side are clearly better than their allegro gradings would suggest. But the time handicap is a big factor, and we were giving a fair bit away.

1st Round

A good start to take a comfortable lead. Vlad frustratingly (for him!) fell into a snap mate against Josh, Alastair won comfortably and Adam rode the storm of the young prodigy Matthew. Keith slipped up but was giving away a lot of time against Steve rated 1430 in Classical, and even that likely an undergrade! Still, a 3-1 lead but we had to be wary. As the higher graded team we neened to win, as a draw would take Castlehill through on board count.

2nd Round

Dundee A 4-4 Castlehill Giants. Castlehill win on board count.

And so it transpired! Alastair got his second win quickly to leave his side needing just a half point from the remaining three games to go through. But Keith wasn’t having his best night and went down again, and Adam succumbed to the form that took Matthew to the Dundee Major title last October. So for the second week running, Joshua was last man standing and battling to give his team the win. But a determined Captain Vlad wouldn’t be denied twice in one night, and made the most of his time advantage to take his side through. A big disappointment for Dundee, winners two seasons out of the last three, but we must applaud Castlehill for their comeback and wish them well for the rest of the competition.

TAFCA Division Two

Certainly not a bad result for the D Team, but they will have regrets. Kat would have been confident having beaten Mike at the Congress a few months back, and gained a clear advantage early on. But a little tactical slip let the experienced Mike crash through for the win. Our Robert was even better off, a piece up on his opponent, but again slipped the peice back and crumbled thereafter. Very good wins though, for Victor on his TAFCA debut against the experienced John, and Andrew’s experience trumped Leo’s youth to gain the draw. Well played everyone.

item.title: TAFCA & Club Championship 13/1/25
item.dc:creator: Ray Flood
item.description: Dundee B 2-2 Castlehill B 1 Joshua Crofts 1779 0-1 Andy Rowe 1562 2 Alastair Dawson 1740 1-0 Robert Jackson 1551 3 Adam Clark 1614 0-1 Keith Rose 1504 4 […]
item.content:encoded:
A tough fixture expected and it certainly materialised. Did it really all come down to four wins for White?!

Adam fell astray in a typically sharp Keith Rose attack against his Caro Kan. Jim’s game was also typical in a different way as he ground down Trevor in the ending. Alastair grabbed an early initiative against untypical innacuracies from Robert, and seized the advantage against his weakened squares and pawns. It was left to Josh and Andy to fight for a win/draw in the last game, and Josh was clearly better right up to the early middlegame where he feels he suffered an aneurysm. An unfortunate slide, but we’ve all been there.

The B Team look safe enough in Division 1, despite ruing the dropped point.

Club Championship Round 1

Gavin Boyd 0-1 Bill Boyd 1564

A solid opening from both players until Bill took control. Gavin being given the lesson “Don’t pin your opponent’s King Bishop before they’ve castled”!

item.title: TAFCA 6/1/25
item.dc:creator: Ray Flood
item.description: Dundee C 4-0 Dundee E 1 Bill Boyd 1564 1-0 Henri Meadows 944 2 Keith Emery 1430 1-0 Norrie Carroll 886 3 Ray Flood 1378 1-0 Steven Leaburn Jnr 693 […]
item.content:encoded: As you’d expect, despite a couple of absentees from both line-ups. A C Team debut for Kat, and very much merited, but I feel she needs the tougher games she’ll get on a higher board for the D Team to keep her terrific progress going, no slight on James who pushed her all the way, as did Henri and Norrie.

item.title: TAFCA 9/12
item.dc:creator: Ray Flood
item.description: Dundee A 4-0 Castlehill A 1 Jacques Ophoff 2312 1-0 Andre Babin 1871 2 Ed Spencer 2166 1-0 Jan Klingelhoefer 1713 3 Sven Stocklose 1990 1-0 Vladyslav Drabych 1648 4 […]
item.content:encoded:
As expected for the Champions, but a few tough fights as ever from Castlehill who fought their corner valiantly. Powering on for a 12th successive title!

The E Team ran into a very experienced Perth side, but acquitted themselves creditably, with Stephen taking advantage of John’s slip. All good experience.

item.title: TAFCA 2/12
item.dc:creator: Ray Flood
item.description: Division 2 Dundee D 2-2 Dundee C 1 Katarina Tanzerova (B) 1280 1-0 Bill Boyd 1564 2 Robert Burnett 1274 0-1 Gordon Robertson 1541 3 Andrew Collins 1100 1-0 Bruce […]
item.content:encoded:
Division 2

A surprise perhaps, but well deserved. Bill lost his way and Kat seized her chance. With Bruce also going down to Andrew’s lightning attack, the C team favourites were 2-0 down and facing our first dropped points of the season. Gordon and I maintained our unbeaten start, and our dignity. Four out of four for Black! It’s undoubtably a setback for the C team promotion hopes, but time enough yet. But well played to the D team, and Kat goes from strength to strength.

item.dc:creator: Ray Flood
item.description: Scottish National Chess League, Dundee City Rounds 3 and 4, 24th November 2024: Report   On Match Day 2, our 4 Dundee City teams set about a long arduous day […]
item.content:encoded:
Scottish National Chess League, Dundee City Rounds 3 and 4, 24th November 2024: Report

 

On Match Day 2, our 4 Dundee City teams set about a long arduous day of chess. Dundee City A and B had a tough day ahead in Division 1 while our C and D teams were battling it out in Division 3. Your author was not able to be present to witness any of the events that unfolded but some were truly spectacular. Two things stand out in particular: first the performance of the B team against Stepps and second the remarkable achievements of our young players.

Lets start in Division 1 with the A-team. In the morning, they proved far too strong for Forth Valley A. The top three boards were drawn but on Board 4 a win by Ed Spencer over William Spiers and on Board 5 a win for George Vayanos over Pranav Hariharan proved to be the decisive factors in a 3.5-1.5 victory. Whilst this match was being played, Dundee City B were up against Bon Accord. The latter team is not as strong as it has been in recent years but still represented a significant obstacle. As it turned out all the boards were drawn with the exception of Board 5 where Matthew Deighan was up against Michael Adam. Michael is a strong player who has recently returned to playing chess after a long absence. It was no surprise therefore that the game was going to be tight. As the game came to its conclusion and with checkmate threats abounding across the board, fortune favoured Matthew who held his nerve to gain full points for the team, the winning score being 3-2.

While the above dramas were unfolding, across the hall in Division 3 the cards fell unfortunately for Dundee City C and D who were paired to play against each other. Several of our young players were involved, most notably Matthew Hunter (J16) who recently tied 1st equal in the Dundee Congress Challenger event. Add to that Ana Seijas Otero who is becoming a stronger and stronger chess player as each season progresses. Then, Nour Afeneh was playing his first day of SNCL chess while on Board 5 for the D team was Katarina Tanzerova who was also having her first day of chess at the SNCL. As the games unfolded, Alisdair McLeod of the C-team proved too strong for Kam Wan. However, for the D-team, Matthew Hunter overwhelmed Jan Klingelhoefer (1715)- a remarkable performance. Then Ana won for the C-team over Franscesco Polignano while Nour Afeneh fell victim to veteran Tom Wardlaw. Then on Board 5, Katarina Tanzerova of the D-team proved victorious over Steve Thomson (1415). When the scores were finally added up, the Dundee City C-team had scraped home as winners by 3-2 but what outstanding performances from Katarina, Ana and Matthew.

In the afternoon, the Dundee A team juggernaut continued to overwhelm all those put in its path. This time it was CS-BOS 1 who were the losers by 1-4. On this occasion David Findlay and Andrew Wright drew on Boards 2 and 3 respectively but the remaining Boards were all won -in this case by Jacques Ophoff (Board 1), Ed Spencer (Board 4) and George Vayanos (Board 5). It should be highlighted that Ed and George won both of their games. In particular, this is showing that young George is proving to be a valuable part of the A-team squad. If this win for the A-team was not in itself significant, one could not have imagined was happening in the B-team games. They were, after all, paired against Stepps and clearly outgraded by more than 200 points on Boards 1 and 2. The remaining 3 Boards were much closer in playing strength. The sense before the game was that there was little chance of the B-team securing a victory but this is exactly what happened. On Board 1 Stephen Hogg was always going to have a difficult time against IM Douglas Bryson and so it proved. However, on Board 2, Andre Babin pulled out all the stops and ended victorious against Chukwuka Allor (2113) a phenomenal achievement. Then on Board 3, Joshua Crofts beat William Hulme (1934), the current captain of Scotlands Senior B-team. On Board 4, Matthew Deighan struggled against an in-form Ian Marks who had just a week earlier came 3rd = in the Oban Congress Open. Finally, but no less significant was Alisdair McLeods win over Ian Brownlee meaning that the B-team had beaten Stepps by 3-2.

The Dundee City C and D teams again fought bravely in the afternoon. The C team were up against Dunfermline Rooks led by Duncan Campbell (1826). This time, Ana and Tom Wardlaw were the stars and, together with a draw from Steve Thomson, they managed to tie the match an excellent performance. A similar outcome was to happen to the D team as they drew against Stonehaven. This time it was our young stars Katarina Tanzerova and Matthew Hunter who secured the wins and, supplemented by a raw from Nour, this match was also tied.

So, at the end of play, by far and away the best team performance was by the B-team with its win over Stepps. Individual performances of the day have to go to Andre Babin for his win over Chukwuka Allor and Matthew Hunter for his victory over Jan Klingelhoefer. Overall, our young Dundee City players were the ones who stood out with their high standard of play and wins. Notable amongst these were George Vayanos for the A-team, Joshua Crofts (yes Joshua you still count as young!) and Matthew Deighan for the B-team, Ana Seijas Otero for the C-team and Katarina Tanzerova together with Matthew Hunter for the D-team.

What an amazing set of performanaces from our Dundee City players very well done!

 

Alastair Dawson

item.title: TAFCA 25/11
item.dc:creator: Ray Flood
item.description: Three matches at the club on Monday, though one was unfortunately curtailed. Otherwise much as would be expected, though the underdogs fought the good fight valiantly. The A team march […]
item.content:encoded:
Three matches at the club on Monday, though one was unfortunately curtailed. Otherwise much as would be expected, though the underdogs fought the good fight valiantly. The A team march on in the defence of their title, C team are well in the hunt after 3 wins in three, and the E team continue to rack up experience.

Club Championship

1st Round

Sam Shepherd - Alastair Dawson 1740

A surprise to be sure, but Sam has acquitted himself very well in his short time at the club. Both the result and the game show great promise.

item.title: Club Championship
item.dc:creator: Ray Flood
item.description: Round 1 1 Anderson James 0-1 Ophoff Jacques 2 Spencer Ed 1-0 Collins Andrew 3 Flood Ray 0-1 Findlay David 4 Crofts Joshua 1-0 Tanzerova Katarina 5 Shepherd Sam - […]
item.content:encoded:
Round 1

1 Anderson James 0-1 Ophoff Jacques
2 Spencer Ed 1-0 Collins Andrew
3 Flood Ray 0-1 Findlay David
4 Crofts Joshua 1-0 Tanzerova Katarina
5 Shepherd Sam - Dawson Alastair
6 Klingelhoefer Jan 1-0 Laland-Brown Thomas
7 Drabych Valdyslav 1-0 De Honor Amabella
8 Clark Adam 1-0 Sim Christine
9 Boyd Gavin P Boyd Bill
10 Robertson John P Carroll Norrie
11 Leaburn Jnr Steven 0-1 Emery Keith
12 Thomson Steve 1-0 McHugh Kara
13 Pollard Stephen 0-1 Wallace Bruce
14 Bouin James 1-0 Soutar Brian
15 Soutar Amy 0-1 Murphy James
16 Bremner Jonathan bye
17 Burnett Robert bye
18 Stewart Owen bye
19 Adebowale Victor bye

All according to the form book for the first round, after some re-pairing. This time we knew the rearranged matches in advance and they’ll be played shortly. A few no-shows though and they’ll be decided later.

item.title: TAFCA & Club Championship 11/11
item.dc:creator: Ray Flood
item.description: TAFCA Division One Dundee B 2- 1 Perth B 1 Joshua Crofts 1779 1-0 Martin Roberts 1564 2 Alastair Dawson 1736 1-0 James Graham 1506 3 Adam Clark 1643 - […]
item.content:encoded:
TAFCA Division One

Dundee B 2- 1 Perth B

Tight stuff, with the B Team 1- down after the first two games finished. The top two had to dig deep to win in the endings, with Joshua particularly struggling somewhat against Martin’s unorthodox play, but he and we got there in the end.

Club Championship

Round 1

Ed Spencer 2166 1-0 Andrew Collins 1100

Our Club Championships kicked off early as Ed and Andy decided to play while they were there. A very nice game too between the former Scottish Champion and Andy, who showed stubborn resistance, allowing Ed to show his attacking prowess. Well played guys!
